author: Scott Derek
title: Clouds, Showers For Tuesday
text:
Monday's climate report Scott Derek View all 7 photos Monday was quite mild with plenty of sunshine and a light breeze(which also led to very low humidity as well); after a seasonable morning low of 51 at Philly Airport the high reached 76 in the afternoon(average high is just 68 now). High pressure was on top of the region, but now a cold front will be approaching from the west and stream in clouds overnight. Lows will range from the upper 40s north and west to the upper 50s in Center City.
NOAA Wednesday morning will be cloudy with showers pushing eastward along the cold front; light showers will arrive by lunchtime with just 0.10" or less of precipitation. Highs will be in the lower 70s with a southerly wind ahead of the cold front, but then we'll clear out overnight so temperatures will drop around 50(40s north and west).
Thursday will be sun-filled and with a westerly wind highs will be in the upper 60s ; a bit cooler on Thursday with highs in the middle 60s with a northwesterly wind, but clouds will increase overnight into Friday morning ahead of a weak front. Light showers will round out the work week, but we'll dry out just in time for the weekend....with a catch! Highs will just be in thr 50s with a northwesterly wind between 15-20mph and that Fall feel will definitely take over!
For now enjoy your night, but don't forget to follow updates on my Twitter account(@scott_derek) as well as check my 7-day forecast(& follow the animated radar) ANY TIME at www.scottderekwx.com .
